snippet: For Afshin Noroozi, an Iranian table tennis player whose request for a work visa in the United States was denied, finishing 65th at the 2008 Olympics and a world ranking of 284 did not qualify as “extraordinary ability.”
abstract: United States Citizen and Immigration Services denies Afshin Noroozi, Iranian table tennis player who finished 65th at 2008 Olympics, an 'extraordinary ability' work visa; case raises question about exactly what status international athlete must achieve before being granted preferential entry into United States.
lead_paragraph: For Afshin Noroozi, an Iranian table tennis player whose request for a work visa in the United States was denied, finishing 65th at the 2008 Olympics and a world ranking of 284 did not qualify as “extraordinary ability.”

headline.seo: Olympic Table Tennis Player Noroozi Falls Short in Work Visa Case
headline.main: Athlete Is Short of ‘Extraordinary’ in Visa Bid
headline.print_headline: Athlete Is Short of ‘Extraordinary’ in Visa Bid
